Author: Alexila
Title: [ANN] Tokensale July 24th- Everex Blockchain-Powered Microfinance & Remittances
Body: Besides being professional blockchain solution developers, we are also professional lenders, risk managers, assessors and collectors. Before issuing the loan the applicant goes thru rigorous, yet automatic, verification with lots of hidden tools. Two major data sources will be used, blockchain itself as data source for transactions (frequency, volumes) and smartphone, from which we derive hundreds of data points that state the credit status of the borrower. (model and brand of the phone, service provider, contact list, sms, camera, social media, etc.), all of this data is being processed by our algorithms and the Yes or No, or if Yes then How Much? decision is issued. We want to think about our app as "credit card on blockchain".  Our default rates is 20% and we also do collections for 3rd parties as well. Take a look at short video of our call center in Yangon, Myanmar.  https://youtu.be/WKJOmbfhvMQ

Author: Alexila
Title: [ANN] Tokensale July 24th- Everex Blockchain-Powered Microfinance & Remittances
Body: Good question. Suretly is an interesting idea to help professional lenders in simplifying lending decision by supporting the borrower with vouching for him random people. As professional collectors we already see that this project may turn to a dating app. (E.g. personally I'd more likely to vouch for a cute girl who needed some money, rather than for a dude). Plus having a "tinder" like interface I'm not sure, but wold love to be proven wrong.  It just gives collectors more options to collect (which is good for us, in fact we will be happy to collect for Suretly lenders) but will this result in acceptable default rates, is yet to be seen.  I wish them all the best, as we all need more financial dapps on the market and less of "pink elephants in a spaceships" with 100s of millions raised, which they don't need.  We, in fact, also will be using vouching system, only not from random strangers, but from from the closest Facebook friends of the borrower. This way if he pays back then, 1. he build his credit score 2. he gets rewarded wit EVX tokens (about 5% from paid interest, like a reward point) 3. his vouching friends are sharing another 5% worth of EVX tokens and building their credit history a bit by vouching for the good borrower. If borrower does not pay back: 1. EVX tokens are taken from his wallet reducing his credit karma 2. EVX tokens are taken from his vouchers wallets, 3. We include vouchers in the collection calls politely suggesting to influence the borrower to be a good person and not angry Buddha but not paying back.

IN SHORT. 1. None of them are on Ethereum blockchain 2. None of them uses smart contracts 3. None of them is transparent (meaning you can see their transactions on blockchain publicly) 4. None of them provides lending services 5. None of them has own stable coin on blockchain 6. None of them solves financial inclusion in regards to building credit scores on blockchain and provide access to capital.  Those guys use bitcoin as rails to move value from one point to another. At the beginning and the end there is still cash. Cash does not create a financial record that helps building credit history. Everex does all of that, which is critical to financial inclusion.  Everex, although not technically a remittance company, was awarded with a REMTECH "Service originality" award in NY last month, so I think we are doing something right.

Author: Alexila
Title: [ANN] Tokensale July 24th- Everex Blockchain-Powered Microfinance & Remittances
Body: Thank you for your questions. I'll be happy to answer as I'm sure more readers would like to know the same  1... how you will evaluate the credit score of these more than 2 billion individuals without a bank account?  we use 2 main data feeds. 1) Transaction records from remittance and payments made within our wallet, which is publicly accessible from Ethereum via our Ethplorer.io blockchain reader, filtered by specific cryptocash currency symbol, e.g. THBEX, and 2) smartphone data, from the model to the information that user allows to access when installing the app. Those two feeds have quite a number of metric points that we analyze to make lending decision. Also, once first loan is paid, the credit line increases, and so forth. This allows underbanked to build own credit history on public transparent blockchain.  2. And how can they access your microcredit services if some of them don't own smartphones?  There are enough users who have smartphones, even in developing countries, and we focus our offer to them. The cost of basic Android phone is going down year by year, and if not next year but in 3 years most of the users will have ability to get a smartphone. Some users may share one smartphone between them, like some of our customers in Myanmar do. Thank you.
